description: Bring home the Ghost Kids Tee from Panamuna Project, and introduce your children to the world of responsible fashion. Crafted on the Tweed Coast of Northern NSW, this tee has been made out of pure 155 GSM organic cotton. The fabric is gentle and keeps your little one comfy. The simple and minimalist design of the tee doesn't compromise on the style quotient of your child, while also helping you make a guilt-free choice.  At Panamuna, our mission is to curate a safe and ethical line of clothing, while protecting our environment. Our creations are carbon neutrally manufactured and ethically traded. Certified by the likes of GOTS (Global Organic Textile Standard), Carbon Trust, Fair Wear Foundation, and Soil Association, our products are here to help you make the right choice.  Our t-shirts are specially designed to spread awareness about environmental issues. So, there's no better way to teach your kids about the importance of sustainable living, than through our products. Place your order today, and put forward a step towards building a sustainable community. CONSTRUCTION

The Empower Tee looks good but it feels even better on your skin. Made from 100% organic, ethically sourced cotton, the t-shirt goes gentle on the skin. The elegant print on the Empower Tee is designed with water-based ink. The t-shirts are printed on-demand, leading to zero waste of resources. Speaking of preserving resources, we at Panamuna Project believe in following a sustainable lifestyle to help our planet breathe easy. Our products, including the Empower Tee, meet the Global Organic Textile Standard (GOTS) while supporting the efforts of Carbon Trust, Fair Wear Foundation, and Soil Association. So the next time you're out with your friends, rocking the Classic Tee under the sun, know that you're part of a community committed to a green lifestyle.  So what are you waiting for? Flaunt the pretty Empower Tee from Panamuna Project to make the world a better place, one shirt at a time.  CONSTRUCTION

Live life your way in a cool Cheap Thrills t-shirt. Crafted in 100% organic cotton and designed on the Tweed Coast of Northern NSW, this is a short-sleeved tee with a retro surf school design perfect for warm-weather wear.  The cotton is crafted with a soft feel and it is ethically produced and GOTS (Global Organic Textile Standard). Throw this vintage look t-shirt on with jeans, shorts, or over your bathers for instant style and comfort. The look with the logo of the surfer dude and massive curl is perfect for a day at the beach or just relaxing with friends.  This casual t-shirt is sure to become a favorite that you will pull out to wear time and again thanks to the 100% cotton construction and thoughtful design details. CONSTRUCTION

Enjoy the feeling of 100% organic cotton and the look of pure style with this cool t-shirt. Decorated with the Panamuna Project Create Change logo, this is an easy t-shirt to wear on any casual occasion.  It is designed on the Tweed Coast of Northern NSW from ethically traded and carbon neutral manufactured organic cotton that is soft to the touch and very durable.  Great for pairing with shorts or jeans and sandals or trainers, this organic cotton t-shirt is designed locally and uses responsible packaging. Simply slip it on for total comfort, it will last you many, many, many wearings and give you peace of mind that only sustainable materials and eco-friendly manufacturing were used to produce it.   CONSTRUCTION

The world may not be a perfect place today, but tomorrow it sure can be! The Future Tee from Panamuna Project is a perfect t-shirt for you if you believe in making the future better, just like us.  The Future Tee is a soft little t-shirt that feels extremely gentle on the skin. We use 100% organic, ethically produced cotton for our products and you will feel the quality when you go out wearing one of them. The Future Tee follows all the efforts to promote ethical businesses for a sustainable future including Global Organic Textile Standard (GOTS), Carbon Trust, Fair Wear Foundation, and Soil Association. We have created the t-shirt with a carbon-neutral process so you can feel good about contributing to a positive effort.  Future Tee is designed in Tweed Coast of Northern NSW, boosting the local businesses and helping the community. The striking prints on the t-shirt are made of water-based ink and we print only on demand.  If you're as serious about the future as we are, there's nothing like starting conversations with some hard-hitting printed t-shirts. Get your Future Tee, today!  CONSTRUCTION

If you're one of those kindred spirits, trying to change the world for the better, then you need an awesome tee to give you company. The Sustainable Tee from Panamuna Project is an ideal t-shirt to complement your revolutionary spirit.  The Sustainable Tee is a minimalist yet bold style statement that aims to bring forth a change. We believe in promoting ethical businesses and we use 100% organic, naturally sourced cotton to design it. The Sustainable Tee champions a sustainable lifestyle by recognisingthe visions of Carbon Trust, Fair Wear Foundation, Soil Association, and the efforts of the Global Organic Textile Standard (GOTS). We think global, but act local. The Sustainable Tee is designed on the Tweed Coast of Northern NSW, promoting local businesses. The bold prints on the Sustainable Tee is achieved by using authentic Panamuna art and water-based ink. We only print on demand because we know that every little effort of conservation matters.  Change starts within - we believe we have to be the change before we bring any change. If you're also one of those good people, the Sustainable Tee is just for you. Order yours today!  CONSTRUCTION

Wear this iconic t-shirt as often as you wish, it is designed for style and durability to give you many seasons of wearing, enjoyment, and comfort. CONSTRUCTION

If you wish to look great while also caring for the environment, the Ride On Tee from the house of Panamuna Project is the perfect choice for you. Made from organic cotton, the fabric is soft to touch and is gentle on your skin. This minimalist yet stylish tee has been designed on the Tweed Coast of Northern NSW. The muted universal tone allows you the freedom to style it however you please– be it with a pair of basic shorts, or denim. A perfect summer-time piece, you can also slip into this tee in winter and throw a jacket on top to ace a fashionable look.  At Panamuna, our creations are ethically produced, ensuring carbon neutral manufacturing. Our clothes are certified by GOTS (Global Organic Textile Standard), Carbon Trust, Fair Wear Foundation, and Soil Association. When you choose us, you can make a conscious choice of clothing, by switching to ethically crafted and environment-friendly attires. Make the Ride On Tee yours today, and take a small step towards a greater change.  CONSTRUCTION

The world needs to be a better version of itself and for that our seas need to be healthier. The Salty Tee from Panamuna Project harkens back a pure, salty, sea life.  We only use ethical methods to create and design our tees and the Salty Tee champions our belief. The Salty Tee uses 100% ethically sourced organic cotton that is light on your skin. The entire creation of the Salty Tee is a carbon-neutral process. We also make sure our products follow the GOTS - Global Organic Textile Standard, and efforts of Carbon Trust, Fair Wear Foundation, and Soil Association. You will feel the difference on your skin when you wear the Salty Tee.  The sophisticated and minimalistic prints on the tees are designed with water-based ink and we print on demand. By doing this, we make sure you get perfectly handcrafted tees while wasting zero resources.  The Salty Tee is not just a beautifully soft tee, it's a way of life. It's about time we start doing the right thing for the vast blue. Order the Salty Tee to be part of the tribe, today! CONSTRUCTION

Rosti has a history of precision plastic injection moulding solutions dating back to 1944. Founded in Denmark by Rolf Fahrenholtz and Stig Jørgensen, Rosti began with the production of buttons by means of injection moulding, shortly after the second World War. This innovative and relatively new method provided increased production at a lower cost compared to conventional press moulding. Our Rosti collection of homeware products now form part of RÆFOUND, an evolving range of original, unworn military apparel and accessories, personally sourced by Christopher Raeburn. Nothing new, nothing wasted.  Original Nepal Service Rosti Spoon Made in Denmark Manufacturing date 1950-60 Cannot be microwaved

The Open Source Fashion Cookbook is designed to democratise sustainable and ethical fashion, enabling all people - especially communities that cannot traditionally afford to shop from responsible brands - to participate in responsible consumption. With detailed “recipes,” including step-by-step illustrations from six contemporary fashion brands including RÆBURN, the Cookbook empowers you to make your own clothing from items that are readily available in your home. We understand that not everyone is a trained sewer, so we included recipes that vary in difficulty, from no-sew easy basics to more advanced designs.Not only does the Cookbook serve as an instructional handbook, but it also includes essays from industry leaders who paint a clearer picture of sustainable fashion and what can be done, both as an industry and as consumers, in order to improve our world. Open Source Fashion Cookbook Edited by Angela Luna and Loulwa Al Saad Published by ADIFF January 2021 Paperback

The RÆBURN Women's Parasuit Shorts have been RÆMADE using original parachute canopies which have been over-dyed in the UK to achieve a textured and lightweight crinkle and then meticulously deconstructed and reconstructed at the RÆBURN Lab in East London. A signature material for the brand since it's first collection in 2009 which featured a range of outerwear constructed from one military parachute, the brands logo which consists of our coloured segments (Sand, Camo Green, Orange and White) also is inspired by and mirrors the C9 Parachute Canopy. The base has been manufactured in Portugal and produced in a 170gsm Global Organic Textile Standard Approved 100% organic cotton interlock which meets the OCS 100 - Organic Content Standard, verifying the presence and amount of organic content in the final raw material. The fabric is piece dyed in in GOTS certified dye house to meet Standard 100 by Oeko-Tex® confirming they have been tested for harmful substances and given carbon brushed finish to give a luxury hand feel. No longer relegated solely to drab or muted earthtones, camouflage is undergoing a renaissance as designers experiment with new patterns and colour palettes to create fresh and unexpected results for a variety of applications. With traditional elements or new figurative or abstract iconography and in every colour of the rainbow, from black and white to the primaries, day-glo colours and pastels. Camo Mania: New Disruptive Patterns in Design Published in 2017 Published by Victionary Paperback

Fashion has always sought to celebrate nature - from sumptuous silks and floral patterns, to the spectacular creations of designers such as Stella McCartney and Christopher Raeburn, it is a centuries-old seam running through the clothes we all wear.In spite of this reverence for the natural world, fashion seems destined to harm it. With essays spanning the 17th century to the present day, Fashioned from Nature examines our dependence on the natural world. The impact of certain trends has been felt for centuries, with sometimes devastating effect as seen in the demand for ivory and exotic feathers. Past generations were not immune to fads – the sudden ubiquity of reptile skin accessories in the 1920s had obvious knock-on effects. That said, the current era of intense consumerism and fast fashion has taken things to a new level and this book discusses the need to develop a more responsible fashion cycle in which both producers and consumers have a stake. Fashioned from Nature Edited by Edwina Ehrman Published by V&A April 2019 Paperback

Three Things is Ana Santi's full-length debut and the story of a to-do list; a collection of essays on how to tackle the climate crisis at individual level, as directed by experts. What if there were three things you could do to fight the climate crisis? Three things that, through collective action, could slow down the rate of greenhouse gas emissions from the food industry? Three things that, if tackled as a community, could reduce air pollution. Three things to make our wardrobes more sustainable? This book features Christopher Raeburn's ideas under 'Wear', alongside essays by Melissa Hemsley, Juliet Kinsman, Eshita Kabra-Davies, Tamsin Blanchard, Tristram Stuart, Gail Bradbrook, Rosamund Kissi-Debrah and Jonathan Safran-Foer. Three Things Book Published by The Pound Project October 2020 Paperback

Getting humans to Mars has become one of the great challenges of our time. It will be an extraordinary technological feat, but also a feat of design. This is the first book dedicated to designing for the Red Planet.Illustrated with more than 300 images and featuring original essays by leading thinkers in their field, Moving to Mars: Design for the Red Planet includes projects by NASA, SpaceX and the European Space Agency, as well as new work by designers and architects including HASSELL, Konstantin Grcic, and Alexandra Daisy Ginsberg. It also includes an interview with the science fiction writer Kim Stanley Robinson, who addresses why speculative design is the ideal discipline for imagining the ‘material grammar' of a life on Mars. RÆBURN's SS20 NEW HORIZONS collection featured in The Design Museum's London exhibition between October 2019 and February 2020, and is now also captured in this exhibition catalog. Moving to Mars: Design for the Red Planet Catalogue Edited by Justin McGuirk, Andrew Nahum and Eleanor Watson Designed by Studio Julia Hardback

Combining a shared love of the oceans and its brilliant biodiversity, we have partnered with lifestyle brand Boardies® to create a capsule collection of bright beachwear, fit to make a splash this summer. Marrying our iconic squid print and Boardies®’ swimwear apparel expertise, the Boardies® × RÆBURN Towels are responsibly designed, lightweight cloths with timeless flair. They are made from breathable, quick-drying TENCEL Lyocell, spun from sustainably sourced natural raw material wood, known for its sustainable production, gentleness on skin, and for its long-lasting softness and biodegradability. Overall, you'll find it easy to roll-up small for your travels, dry-up quickly and wrap-up in versatile ways.For each item sold, we will donate 10% of profits to WWF UK, helping the fight against plastic pollution in waterways around the world. RÆBURN Squid print Boardies® × RÆBURN label Fabric Details100% TENCEL LyocellDimensions80x182cm

Marrying our iconic squid print and Boardies®’ swimwear apparel expertise, the Boardies® × RÆBURN Hawaiian Shirts are responsibly designed, premium quality short sleeved tees with timeless flair. They are made from breathable, quick-drying TENCEL Lyocell, spun from sustainably sourced natural raw material wood.Known for its sustainable production, gentleness on skin, and for its long-lasting softness and biodegradability, this bright shirt will ensure that you have fun in the sun.For each item sold, we will donate 10% of profits to WWF UK, helping the fight against plastic pollution in waterways around the world. RÆBURN Squid print Chest pocket with RÆBURN tab Collared neckline Corozo nut buttons on front Regular fit Fabric Details100% TENCEL LyocellModel is 6'1"/186cm with a 36"/91cm chest and wears a size Medium

The RÆBURN Fabric Shop was born from visitors to the Lab Tours and Workshops mentioning that they cannot find affordable, environmentally-considered fabrics by the metre — we want to help that. Our Fabric Shop is located within the RÆBURN Lab in Hackney and offers a vibrant library of previous seasons and under-utilised materials from fabrics to trims, including a range of partner mill materials and digital prints. We hereby hope to provide all creative abilities the access to responsible craft, globally and affordably.This cord is a byproduct of the military Air Brake Parachutes we utilise in our RÆMADE collections. Features & Benefits Original Air Brake Parachute Cord Military Surplus 15mm width Fabric Details100% NylonEach unit comes in 5m length.

The RÆBURN Fabric Shop was born from visitors to the Lab Tours and Workshops mentioning that they cannot find affordable, environmentally-considered fabrics by the metre — we want to help that. Our Fabric Shop is located within the RÆBURN Lab in Hackney and offers a vibrant library of previous seasons and under-utilised materials from fabrics to trims, including a range of partner mill materials and digital prints. We hereby hope to provide all creative abilities the access to responsible craft, globally and affordably.This parachute ripstop is available in our signature brand colours, as found in a 28’ parachute used by air forces globally. Unique for their colour blocked construction, white, olive and sand hues allow for camouflage whilst orange allows for signalling and detection.Features & Benefits Parachute Ripstop Nylon Deadstock / Manufacturing seconds Width: 94cm Soft Finish Construction: Ripstop Weave Area Density: 45gsm Fabric Details100% Polyamide (Nylon) Unit price is per metre of fabric

description: Part of the RÆBURN Zoo capsule collection this Panda Print Tee has been manufactured in Portugal and produced in a 170gsm Global Organic Textile Standard Approved 100% organic cotton interlock which meets the OCS 100 - Organic Content Standard, verifying the presence and amount of organic content in the final raw material. The F.C. RÆBURN Scarf has been manufactured in Portugal and produced in a 12gg jacquard knit using 100% Merino Wool. Merino wool is a natural fibre grown year-round by Merino sheep on farms around the world. Every year these sheep produce new fleece, making wool a completely renewable fibre and Merino wool is the world’s finest and softest wool in the world. Its natural benefits are so great that no other fibre - natural or man-made - can match it for its quality and versatility. These items meet Standard 100 by Oeko-Tex® confirming they have been tested for harmful substances and certified by Woolmark with regards colour fastness meeting standards  TM250, TM165 and TM5. Jacquard knit, 12 gauge Straight finish to outer edges Signature RÆBURN logo design RÆBURN RÆCYCLED merino label to front hem RÆBURN branded label to reverse Fabric Details100% Merino Wool

display_name: Aesop × Ræburn Ræmade Adventurer Roll Up
description: The limited-editionRÆMADEAdventurer Roll Upis a portable hand care pouch for commuting, travelling, or those on-the-go, and is the result of a collaborativeproject with B Corp certified skincare brand Aēsop. The Roll Up features three purpose-fit pockets that house a trio of Aēsop products for cleansing and hydrating the hands.Only 300 limited-edition versions are available.Crafted from original 1960's aeronautical navigation maps of eitherBorneo or the Aral Sea, these mapsdepict areas of the world particularly damaged through environmental degradation. AllRÆMADEAdventurer Roll Ups have beenhandcraftedin the RÆBURN Lab in East London, creatingfour Roll Ups from just one map to leave minimal waste.They are securely rolled up in a co-branded cotton tape.Fabric Details·Pouch: 100% Rayon Map·Tape: 100% CottonContent Details·Resurrection Rinse-Free Hand Wash50mlA non-drying, alcohol-based formulation with purifying and hydrating properties, to cleanse hands effectively when fresh water is unavailable. Key ingredients are Mandarin Rind, Rosemary Leaf, Cedar Atlas. Alcohol content is 58-62%.·Resurrection Aromatique Hand Balm75mlA blend of fragrant botanicals and skin-softening emollients that delivers rich hydration to labour-wearied hands and cuticles.Key ingredients are Mandarin Rind, Rosemary Leaf, Cedar Atlas.·Resurrection Rinse-Free Hand Mist50mlA gentle gel-based formulation that cleanses thoroughly without drying the skin or stripping its natural oils.Key ingredients are Witch Hazel, Salicylic Acid, Sage Leaf.The RÆMADE Adventurer Roll Up measures26.5 x 18cmNote: All Aēsop products are vegan and cruelty-free, and no ingredient utilised in the formulations is tested on animals.

The Standard Issue Tab Beanie hat features RÆBURN branded tab and has been manufactured in Portugal and produced in a 7gg, 1x1 double knit using 100% Merino Wool. Merino wool is a natural fibre grown year-round by Merino sheep on farms around the world. Every year these sheep produce new fleece, making wool a completely renewable fibre and Merino wool is the world’s finest and softest wool in the world. Its natural benefits are so great that no other fibre - natural or man-made - can match it for its quality and versatility. These items meet Standard 100 by Oeko-Tex® confirming they have been tested for harmful substances and certified by Woolmark with regards colour fastness meeting standards  TM250, TM165 and TM5. 7 gauge, 1x1 double knit Solid colour beanie RÆBURN branded tab to rib lip RÆBURN branded label to internal beanie Fabric Details100% Merino Wool

The RÆBURN Men's Lightweight Jacket is produced in 100% certified RÆCYCLED polyester ripstop made from RÆCYCLED PET plastic bottles. This shell fabric is thin, lightweight and shower resistant. Developed in Japan, the inclusion of raised squares in the fabric helps to prevent it from ripping making it highly functional and great for outdoor use. It is embellished with RÆCYCLED grosgrain tape detailing, a signature dating back to Christopher's very first collection and inspired by parachute seam details. The entire garment can be packed into its own pocket to create a small compact pouch, making it versatile and perfect for travelling. Signature grosgrain tape detailing x2 front pockets concealed within angled seam panelling Packaway front pocket feature Lampo moulded zip w. NEW LIFE tape RÆBURN branded puller in antique nickel RÆBURN branded velcro patch to sleeve Stand collar Rib insert at cuff for improved fit Internal RÆBURN brand label Detachable RÆBURN branded lanyard Fabric Details100% RÆCYCLED PolyesterModel is 6'2"/188cm with a 37"/94cm chest and wears a size Medium

TheAirBrakeBucketHatis RÆMADE from originalairbrakeparachute overlaid onto a recycled polyester base, and crafted at the RÆBURN Lab. The style features a flat-topped crown with fluted brim, signature RÆBURN label to the centre front and bound internal finish. Each piece differs slightly depending on the placement of the parachute.Fabric DetailsOriginal Air Brake Parachutes (Nylon) with RÆCYCLED PolyesterNote:RÆMADE items have been created by taking existing surplus materials, products and artefacts and reworking them into completely new products. As a result of this upcycling process, no two RÆMADE products are identical and may include some inherent faults and/or characteristics of the original materials, products and artefacts used to make them.

description: The RÆBURN Women's RAF Hi-Vis PKT Tee features a chest pocket RÆMADE from Hi-vis PTFE Jackets from the RAF, originally reversible with one side navy and the inside fluorescent. The base has been manufactured in Portugal and produced in a 170gsm Global Organic Textile Standard Approved 100% organic cotton interlock. It meets the OCS 100 - Organic Content Standard, verifying the presence and amount of organic content in the final raw material. The fabric is piece dyed in in GOTS certified dye house to meet Standard 100 by Oeko-Tex® which confirms that they have been tested for harmful substances. Each garment is given a carbon brushed finish resulting in a soft luxury hand feel. The RÆBURN Parachute Sling W/Bhas been RÆMADE using original parachute canopies which have been over-dyed in the UK to achieve a textured and lightweight crinkle and then meticulously deconstructed and reconstructed at the RÆBURN Lab in East London. A signature material for the brand since it's first collection in 2009 which featured a range of outerwear constructed from one military parachute, the brands logo which consists offour coloured segments (Sand, Camo Green, Orange and White) also is inspired by and mirrors the C9 Parachute Canopy. TheAdventurer Roll Upis a portable hand care pouch for commuting, travelling, or those on-the-go, and is the result of a collaborativeproject with B Corp certified skincare brand Aēsop. The Roll Up features three purpose-fit pockets that house a trio of Aēsop products for cleansing and hydrating the hands. Handcrafted from pre-consumer recycled cotton in a sophisticated navy blue, the pouch is securely rolled up in a co-branded cotton tape.Fabric Details·Pouch: Pre-Consumer Recycled Cotton·Tape: 100% CottonContent Details·Resurrection Rinse-Free Hand Wash50mlA non-drying, alcohol-based formulation with purifying and hydrating properties, to cleanse hands effectively when fresh water is unavailable. Key ingredients are Mandarin Rind, Rosemary Leaf, Cedar Atlas. Alcohol content is 58-62%.·Resurrection Aromatique Hand Balm75mlA blend of fragrant botanicals and skin-softening emollients that delivers rich hydration to labour-wearied hands and cuticles.Key ingredients are Mandarin Rind, Rosemary Leaf, Cedar Atlas.·Resurrection Rinse-Free Hand Mist50mlA gentle gel-based formulation that cleanses thoroughly without drying the skin or stripping its natural oils.Key ingredients are Witch Hazel, Salicylic Acid, Sage Leaf.The Adventurer Roll Up measures26.5 x 18cmNote: All Aēsop products are vegan and cruelty-free, and no ingredient utilised in the formulations is tested on animals.

The Standard Issue Tab Beanie hat features RÆBURN branded tab and has been manufactured in Portugal and produced in a 7gg, 1x1 double knit using 100% Merino Wool. Merino wool is a natural fibre grown year-round by Merino sheep on farms around the world. Every year these sheep produce new fleece, making wool a completely renewable fibre and Merino wool is the world’s finest and softest wool in the world. Its natural benefits are so great that no other fibre - natural or man-made - can match it for its quality and versatility. These items meet Standard 100 by Oeko-Tex® confirming they have been tested for harmful substances and certified by Woolmark with regards colour fastness meeting standards  TM250, TM165 and TM5. 7 gauge, 1x1 double knit Solid colour beanie RÆBURN branded tab to rib lip RÆBURN branded label to internal beanie Fabric Details100% Merino Wool

The RÆBURN Standard Issue A5 Sling is produced in 100% certified RÆCYCLED polyester ripstop made from RÆCYCLED PET plastic bottles. This shell fabric is thin and lightweight but the inclusion of raised squares in the fabric helps to prevent it from ripping making it highly functional and great for outdoor use. Developed in Japan, the fabric is shower resistant and features our iconic RÆMADE, RÆDUCED, RÆCYCLED tape. The RÆBURN Men's Air Brake Shorts have been RÆMADE using original Air Brake Parachutes (also known as Drogue parachutes) which have been over-dyed in the UK. Air Brake Parachutes are designed for deployment from a rapidly-moving objects to decrease speed, provide control and stability, or as a pilot parachute to deploy larger parachutes and used by aircraft, and spacecraft recovery systems. These items have been meticulously deconstructed and reconstructed at the RÆBURN Lab in East London to deliver this series of reimagined legwear. description: The Women's RÆJUVENATE Tee features a robotic dapple print over the front and back. Designed by AATB, a design practice exploring Human-Machine Interactions through the lens of kinetic and interactive devices, each dapple spot is printed individually using a robotic arm, and following a digitised artwork created by RÆBURN and AATB. The base has been manufactured in Portugal and produced in a 170gsm Global Organic Textile Standard Approved 100% organic cotton interlock. It meets the OCS 100 - Organic Content Standard, verifying the presence and amount of organic content in the final raw material. The fabric is piece dyed in in GOTS certified dye house to meet Standard 100 by Oeko-Tex® which confirms that they have been tested for harmful substances. Each garment is given a carbon brushed finish resulting in a soft luxury hand feel. The Men’s ACU Quilt Jacket is a deconstructed design with straight cuffs, RÆMADE from original US military wet-weather quilt poncho liners in Universal Digital (ACU) camo. These are traditionally utilised as a versatile bit of equipment in the field, whether as insulation blankets or shelter. The outer is made from a lightweight and quick-drying ripstop nylon, and is quilted for added strength and durability. Each has been meticulously deconstructed and reconstructed at the RÆBURN Lab in East London. This oversizedAdvance Down System (ADS)Gilet is a product of our innovativepartnership with Tokyo basedtechnical fashion group ONWARD.Combining meticulous Japanese material innovation, patented technology and the creativity of London, the partnership has resulted in our most forward-thinking range of performance outerwear to date.Featuring patented techwear innovation, the ADS Gilet is a fully reversible style with a light fill of recycled down, and our signature tape detailing on the front.ADS is ONWARD's new down structure featuring “Z tapes” that enable air to circulate whilst allowing a flexible fit. Whereas horizontal stitching is commonly required to prevent the filling from dispersing unevenly, this innovative recycled down structure retains even volume and warmth whilst remaining lightweight overall. ADS patented technology Fully reversible Detachable branded lanyard Two way auto resistant and reversible zipper Water repellent zip Cargo style snap pockets on front Zipped side entry pockets with fleece interior Storm flap with iridescent vinyl detail Shoulder carrier straps Iridescent heat transfer logo ADS RAEBURN hangloop Two zip pockets on reverse Fabric Details Shell: 100% Recycled Nylon Lining: 100% Japanese Nylon Filling: 100% Post-consumer recycled down Christopher is 6'5"/195cm with a42"/106cmchest and wears a sizeLarge for a relaxed fit

description: Part of the RÆFOUND collection, an evolving non seasonal capsule consisting of never before worn military garments individually selected for their innovative functionality, durability and unique style. Personally sourced by Christopher Raeburn, then quality checked and wear tested at the RÆBURN Lab. This Lightweight Thermal Smock is a British military windproof synthetic jacket with lightweight thermal fleece lining, featuring a front half zip style. Key details include a detachable lanyard zip-pull, multiple zip functionality offering underarm ventilation, packable hood function, side waist zip detail and front zip compartment pocket. Full garment is packable into main central pocket. Model is 6'2"/189cm with a 38"/96cm chest and wears a size Medium. Please contact us for any sizing queries.Note:Please note this garment is kept in its original state with only branded embellishments attached.

The RÆMADE Pencil Case has been made in the RÆBURN Lab in Hackney, RÆMADE using original Air Brake Parachutes (also known as Drogue parachutes) covers. Air Brake Parachute's are designed for deployment from a rapidly-moving objects to decrease speed, provide control and stability, or as a pilot parachute to deploy larger parachutes and used by aircraft, and spacecraft recovery systems.This Pencil Case is ideal for housing your RÆMADE Denim Pencil and variety of RÆPAIR tools. Original nylon webbing feature throughout external body  1.5cm grosgrain detail bordering main compartment  RÆCYCLED branded RÆBURN label and tab  Repurposed dead stock black RiRi metal zip Bound internally for clean finish   Fabric DetailsCotton nylon mixThe RÆMADE Pencil Case measures 11x24cmNote:RÆMADE items have been created by taking existing surplus materials, products and artefacts and reworking them into completely new products. As a result of this upcycling process, no two RÆMADE products are identical and may include some inherent faults and/or characteristics of the original materials, products and artefacts used to make them.

Suitable for small tears and holes on a variety of fabrics. x1 RÆPAIR C9 Parachute patch x1 RÆPAIR patch Step by step instructions included, please read before starting RÆPAIR  RÆPAIR patches cannot be used on coated fabrics* Fabric DetailsRÆCYCLED woven polyester yarns backed with heat activated adhesive The RÆPAIR C9 Parachute patch measures 5x5cm The RÆPAIR patch measures 6x2cm

description: The RÆBURN Multi Map Silk Face Covering has been crafted in London and features a digital print of an aeronautical weather map.Printed onto 100% RÆDUCED Silk Habotai from the UK, each item is entirely unique depending on which part of the printed map we use. The Russian Blanket Cushion, Small is crafted using a decommissioned Russian Naval blanket from the Soviet era. These blankets were particularly effective at keeping the user warm in harsh winters due to their dense handwoven construction. Designed at the RÆBURN Lab in East London, the cushion has a premium weight and soft woollen handfeel. The irregularity and uniqueness of geometric pattern means each cushion is entirely unique depending on which blanket use. The RÆBURN Women's Standard Issue Venn Tee features RÆBURN's venn diagram RÆMADE, RÆDUCED, RÆCYCLED ethos logo vinyl. The base has been manufactured in Portugal and produced in a 170gsm Global Organic Textile Standard Approved 100% organic cotton interlock. It meets the OCS 100 - Organic Content Standard, verifying the presence and amount of organic content in the final raw material. The fabric is piece dyed in in GOTS certified dye house to meet Standard 100 by Oeko-Tex® which confirms that they have been tested for harmful substances. Each garment is given a carbon brushed finish resulting in a soft luxury hand feel. The 1950's Silk Maps are an increasingly rare artefact that have become an iconic part of the brand, forming an evolving range of luxurious womenswear and accessory pieces. Originally given to Royal Air Force crewmen in WW2 and beyond into the Cold War period of the 1950's, they helped individuals find a route out of enemy territory.⁠ Crafted at the RÆBURN Lab in East London, each piece is entirely unique depending on which part of the individual map we use. 1950's Silk Map Pillow Overlaid onto organic cotton Organic cottoncushionpad Concealed zip fastening Fabric Details100% Silk (front) on organic cottonThe 1950's Silk Map Pillow measures 77cm x 49cm x 26cmNote:RÆMADE items have been created by taking existing surplus materials, products and artefacts and reworking them into completely new products. RÆBURN develop an animal mascot with every season bringing an element of humour whilst also informing seasonal graphics/print that can be found throughout our collections. Importantly the animals selected are often in depleting numbers and at risk of extinction and we hope that these playful characters also serve to raise awareness throughout the world. The RÆBURN Puffin Mascot has been meticulously crafted at the RÆBURN Lab in East London in Limited Editions. They feature a digital print developed by RÆBURN using award-winning Icelandic photographer Ragnar Axelsson (“Rax”) imagery. For over 40 years RAX has been photographing the people, animals and landscape of the most remote regions of the Arctic, including Iceland, Siberia and Greenland. This original full colour image captured by Rax show haunting images of fragmented glaciers standing as future relics bearing witness to the immediate and direct threat of global warming whilst also acting as a celebration of the natural beauty of the Arctic.Printed onto 100% certified RÆCYCLED polyester made from RÆCYCLED PET plastic bottles. Developed in Japan the fabric is brushed with PFC free DWR making it shower resistant and providing a cotton-feel touch. Fabric DetailsRÆCYCLED Polyester MixThe Puffin Mascot measures 30x24cm

The Multi Map Silk Scarf is developed in the RÆBURN Lab using a digital print of aeronautical weather map. Printed onto 100% RÆDUCED Silk Habotai from the UK, each piece is entirely unique depending on which part of the printed map we use.Fabric Details100% Silk HabotaiThe Multi Map Silk Scarf measures 100 x 100cm

The Air Brake Cushion has been RÆMADE using original Air Brake Parachutes (also known as Drogue parachutes) which have been over-dyed in the UK. Air Brake Parachute's are designed for deployment from a rapidly-moving objects to decrease speed, provide control and stability, or as a pilot parachute to deploy larger parachutes and used by aircraft, and spacecraft recovery systems. These items have been meticulously deconstructed and reconstructed at the RÆBURN Lab. Each piece differs slightly depending on the placement of the parachute. The RÆBURN Shark Face Covering 3 Pack offers a great bundle saving. These sustainable and reusable non-medical face coverings for use alongside existing social distancing measures and is produced in GOTS certified luxury organic cotton sateen (tight weave) using European Union REACH compliant non-toxic print inks and dyes suitable for sensitive skin and use in all weathers and a snug fit design around nose and mouth. Designed in London and produced with love by a 90% female workforce these face coverings can be reused 50+ times and being produced from a compostable and biodegradable cotton fabric with no single-use plastic they also protect our planet. Each face covering comes with a luxury cotton sateen fabric protective pouch for storage of your face covering when not in use. The RÆBURN Parachute Sling W/Bhas been RÆMADE using original parachute canopies which have been over-dyed in the UK to achieve a textured and lightweight crinkle and then meticulously deconstructed and reconstructed at the RÆBURN Lab in East London. A signature material for the brand since it's first collection in 2009 which featured a range of outerwear constructed from one military parachute, the brands logo which consists offour coloured segments (Sand, Camo Green, Orange and White) also is inspired by and mirrors the C9 Parachute Canopy. The RÆBURN Men's Ripstop Overshirt has been manufactured in Portugal and produced in 100% nylon ripstop material used to make military cargo parachutes developed primarily for use in the deceleration and stabilisation of bulk-type platform air delivery cargo loads. The Russian Blanket is an original decommissioned Russian Naval blanket from the Soviet era. These blankets were particularly effective at keeping the user warm in harsh winters due to their dense handwoven construction. Finished at the RÆBURN Lab in East London, these blankets have a premium weight and soft woollen handfeel. The irregularity and uniqueness of geometric pattern means each is entirely unique depending on which blanket use.Fabric Details80% cotton, 20% Polyester﻿The Russian Blanket measures 200cm x 140cmNote:RÆMADE items have been created by taking existing surplus materials, products and artefacts and reworking them into completely new products. description: The RÆBURN Men's 1950's Silk Map Pkt Tee has been manufactured in Portugal and produced in a 170gsm Global Organic Textile Standard Approved 100% organic cotton interlock which meets the OCS 100 - Organic Content Standard. The 1950's Silk Maps are an increasingly rare artefact that have become an iconic part of the brand, forming an evolving range of luxurious womenswear and accessory pieces. Originally given to Royal Air Force crewmen in WW2 and beyond into the Cold War period of the 1950's, they helped individuals find a route out of enemy territory.⁠Made to order and crafted at the RÆBURN Lab in East London with a 1-2 week delivery time. The RÆBURN Women's Standard Issue Venn Tee features RÆBURN's venn diagram RÆMADE, RÆDUCED, RÆCYCLED ethos logo vinyl. The base has been manufactured in Portugal and produced in a 170gsm Global Organic Textile Standard Approved 100% organic cotton interlock. The fabric is piece dyed in in GOTS certified dye house to meet Standard 100 by Oeko-Tex® which confirms that they have been tested for harmful substances. Each garment is given a carbon brushed finish resulting in a soft luxury hand feel. The RÆBURN Spot Camo Scarf features RÆBURN's iconic spot camouflage design and has been manufactured in Portugal and produced in a 12gg jacquard knit using 100% Merino Wool. Merino wool is a natural fibre grown year-round by Merino sheep on farms around the world. Every year these sheep produce new fleece, making wool a completely renewable fibre and Merino wool is the world’s finest and softest wool in the world. Its natural benefits are so great that no other fibre - natural or man-made - can match it for its quality and versatility. These items meet Standard 100 by Oeko-Tex® confirming they have been tested for harmful substances and certified by Woolmark with regards colour fastness meeting standards  TM250, TM165 and TM5. The RÆBURN Men's Standard Issue Tee features RÆBURN's embroidered parachute logo to left chest. This box will include 3 or 5 cotton fair trade scarves that are seconds. This is a mystery box, but if you have a preference for certain colors or for block printed or ikat prints, just let us know my adding your request in the order notes section at checkout. What is a second? These arescarves that don’t quite meet the cut usually due to small printing or weaving mistakes. Thesescarves are still completely wearable, but not acceptable for us to sell at full price. We believe that selling these seconds is a great way for everyone to participate in sustainable fashion and we are not sending items to landfills.

display_name: Seconds Box Of 3 Garments- Pick Your Styles (Tops, Bottoms & Dresses)- Size Xsmall
description: This box will include 3 garments that are seconds. You can pick the garments you would like. See below. What is a second? These are garments that don’t quite meet the cut usually due to small printing or weaving mistakes. These garments are still completely wearable, but not acceptable for us to sell at full price. We believe that selling these seconds is a great way for everyone to participate in sustainable fashion and we are not sending items to landfills. Beloware the items you can pick from in your box. You can click on each item to see pictures of the garment. At checkout, in the order notes please list 3-5 options of garments that you would like in your box. We ask for you to give us a couple of extra options in case if your choice(s) are already taken.  Oceana Dress Salmon Stripes Dress Clementine Pants Maxwell Button Shirt Chambray Pants Jane Plaid Dress Chambray Shift Dress Please feel free to email us with any questions regarding the box: katie@passionlilie.com If you would like to see some pictures of the weave defects we are referring to, please look at our other products labeled Seconds. Your purchase helps provide a secure job with fair wages and a positive working environment to artisans in Indiaand the United States. *100% cotton *Fair trade & made in India *Designed in New Orleans   *All sales final on these garments

display_name: Newborn Baby Bundle: Set Of 6 Items
description: The perfect starter set for your newborn baby or as a gift. Featuring 6 fair trade super soft and organic newborn baby essentials. Snap long sleeve body suit, cozy hat to help regulate baby’s body temperature, pull on elastic waistband shorts and pants, 2 snap adjustable bib and 28” X 28" swaddle blanket.  Want to add a gift note? No problem. Just add your gift note at checkout. All orders come in a gift box. When you purchase our organic cotton baby clothes, you do more than provide comfortable organic clothing for yourbaby. As you know, the situation across the world has been changing every day. As of March 24th, the government of India has declared a 21 day lock down. This means all the workshops Passion Lilie has teamed up with must close for 21 days. The owners of these workshops have committed to paying salaries duringthis closure. These owners are small business owners with families of their own to support. Passion Lilie, would like to help them, but our cash flow has also been challenged during this difficult time. We are asking those who can to please donate to our Resilience Fund. All the money will go directly to paying wages for the artisans in India who make Passion Lilie’s products. Please note this donation will be in addition to the wages we already pay our team for the work they do for Passion Lilie. Please choose the amount you would like to give. All donations of $50 and over will receive a free tote bag and headband. If you choose to give over $100, please increase the quantities.

display_name: Organic Cotton Classic Tank With C-Fiber™—Stone
size: ['Stone XXS', 'Stone XS', 'Stone S', 'Stone M', 'Stone L', 'Stone XL']
description: The material of the Seaweed Fiber Tank Tops is ribbed, with a soft-hand feel.  Seaweed grows freely and abundantly in a natural ocean habitat. We source ours from the sparsely populated Icelandic Fjords, in locations where there is zero waste in the water, and zero pollution from ship traffic. The process removes only the part that is able to regenerate and is harvested every 4 years, allowing for full replenishment in between. The fiber is carbon neutral and 100% biodegradable. ###

The material of the Organic Cotton Dresses is ribbed, with a soft-hand feel. The dresses are fitted and come in a mid-weight fabric.  We use 100%  certified organic cotton which is a chemical-free and non-irritant fabric. Grown without the use of harmful pesticides and fertilizers, it is suitable for all types of skin, especially those with sensitive skin. We have also taken precautions to ensure it is completely safe, free from toxic colours, fragrances, bleaches and other harmful products. Our styles are still available in the sizes you know and love, we’ve simply adjusted them to US 0-US 10 so it’s a bit easier to choose which size is right for you.Please note, your product may still have our previous size convention on the label (eg. if you have ordered a US 8, you may receive your garment with a size S label but don’t worry, the measurements haven’t changed).###

size: ['Indian Ocean XS', 'Indian Ocean S', 'Indian Ocean M', 'Indian Ocean L', 'Indian Ocean XL']
description: The colors of the Ocean Collection are inspired by the natural hues of the world’s 3 largest bodies of water: The Pacific, Atlantic and Indian Oceans. The Indian Ocean is the third largest ocean and is the warmest in the world.  We used Environmentally Friendly Dyes and a recycled water system to create these vibrant colors. The method uses a dyeing process with low water consumption and treatment of textile effluents, aiming to reuse water during the washing processes. We created these breathable summer Track Pants using a lightweight fabric similar to 'terry cotton', made from 100% Organic Cotton.  ###

We created this Kids Hoodie in Grey using organic cotton. We used Environmentally Friendly Dyes and a recycled water system to create this neutral color. The method uses a dyeing process with low water consumption and treatment of textile effluents, aiming to reuse water during the washing processes. ###

All PANGAIA Kids T-shirts are made from 100% organic cotton which is chemical-free, and therefore a completely non-irritant fabric. Grown without the use of harmful pesticides and fertilizers, it is suitable for all types of skin, especially those with sensitive skin. We have taken precautions to ensure it is completely safe, free from toxic colours, fragrances, bleaches and other harmful products. So, you can rest assured that what you're putting on your child is 100% natural. It also feels much softer than regular cotton, so it's great for children's sensitive skin. ###

TheSustainable Long Sleeve tee from Panamuna Project bears a message of sustainability, allowing you to spread awareness about the environment. If you have been looking for responsible companies that create cruelty-free, ethically produced, and locally created clothing, this tee is your perfect choice. Designed on the Tweed Coast of Northern NSW, this beautiful tee comes with long sleeves, and thanks to the versatile design, you can style it in many ways. Made from 100% organic cotton of 155 GSM, the feathery soft fabric promises total comfort throughout all seasons.  The creations of the Panamuna Project carry the approval of GOTS (Global Organic Textile Standard), Carbon Trust, Fair Wear Foundation, and Soil Association. Thanks to the practice of carbon-neutral manufacturing and responsible trading, our clothing line is entirely based on sustainability. If you wish for the betterment of the planet, and you want to contribute towards nature conservation, choose our safe and responsible products. Each of the products is packed in eco-friendly packaging, to minimize the harmful impact on the planet. Our exclusive collection of t-shirts exude a beachy vibe while upholding the significance of a conscious lifestyle. So place an order today, and indulge in some guilt-free shopping!   CONSTRUCTION

The RÆBURN Long Sleeve Men's Standard Issue Tee features RÆBURN's embroidered parachute logo. The Tee has been manufactured in Portugal and produced in a 170gsm Global Organic Textile Standard Approved 100% organic cotton interlock. It meets the OCS 100 - Organic Content Standard, verifying the presence and amount of organic content in the final raw material. The fabric is piece dyed in in GOTS certified dye house to meet Standard 100 by Oeko-Tex® which confirms that they have been tested for harmful substances. Each garment is given a carbon brushed finish resulting in a soft luxury hand feel. Organic interlock w. carbon brush finish Organic cotton rib to collar Signature RÆBURN set in sleeve to frontshoulder, extending to raglan seam at back RÆBURN branded tab to side seam Straight hem finish Cover stitch seam construction throughout RÆBURN embroidered logo to chest RÆBURN branded tape to internal neckline Fabric Details100% Organic Cotton InterlockModel is 6'2"/188cm with a 37"/94cm chest and wears a size Medium

The Standard Issue Logo Beanie hat features RÆBURN branded velcro patch to centre front and has been manufactured in Portugal and produced in a 7gg, 1x1 double knit using 100% Merino Wool. Merino wool is a natural fibre grown year-round by Merino sheep on farms around the world. Every year these sheep produce new fleece, making wool a completely renewable fibre and Merino wool is the world’s finest and softest wool in the world. Its natural benefits are so great that no other fibre - natural or man-made - can match it for its quality and versatility. The RÆBURN Men's Standard Issue Anorak is produced in 100% certified RÆCYCLED polyester ripstop made from RÆCYCLED PET plastic bottles. This shell fabric is thin, lightweight and shower resistant. Developed in Japan, the inclusion of raised squares in the fabric helps to prevent it from ripping making it highly functional and great for outdoor use. It is embellished with RÆCYCLED grosgrain tape detailing, a signature dating back to Christopher's very first collection and inspired by parachute seam details. The entire garment can be packed into its own pocket to create a small compact pouch, making it versatile and perfect for travelling. Signature grosgrain tape detailing x2 front pockets concealed within angled seam panelling Packaway front pocket feature Lampo moulded zip w. NEW LIFE tape RÆBURN branded puller in antique nickel RÆBURN branded velcro patch to sleeve Adjustable drawstring hood feature Rib insert at cuff for improved fit Internal RÆBURN brand label Detachable RÆBURN branded lanyard Fabric Details100% RÆCYCLED PolyesterModel is 6'2"/188cm with a 37"/94cm chest and wears a size Medium

The RÆBURN Women's Parasuit Dress has been RÆMADE using original parachute canopies which have been over-dyed in the UK to achieve a textured and lightweight crinkle and then meticulously deconstructed and reconstructed at the RÆBURN Lab in East London to deliver this series of reimagined Dresses. A signature material for the brand since it's first collection in 2009 which featured a range of outerwear constructed from one military parachute, the brands logo which consists of our coloured segments (Sand, Camo Green, Orange and White) also is inspired by and mirrors the C9 Parachute Canopy. Signature RÆBURN PARASUIT Dress Dyed parachute with crinkle finish Straight front neck w. cut away back neckline Straight cuff with stepped hemline Vent detail to side seam Internal RÆBURN brand label Fabric DetailsOriginal Canopy Parachutes (Nylon)Model is 5'9"/177cm with a 31.5"/80cm chest and wears a size SmallNote:RÆMADE items have been created by taking existing surplus materials, products and artefacts and reworking them into completely new products. As a result of this upcycling process, no two RÆMADE products are identical and may include some inherent faults and/or characteristics of the original materials, products and artefacts used to make them.

The RÆBURN Shark Scarf features RÆBURN's iconic oversized shark design and has been manufactured in Portugal and produced in a 12gg jacquard knit using 100% Merino Wool. Merino wool is a natural fibre grown year-round by Merino sheep on farms around the world. Every year these sheep produce new fleece, making wool a completely renewable fibre and Merino wool is the world’s finest and softest wool in the world. Its natural benefits are so great that no other fibre - natural or man-made - can match it for its quality and versatility. These items meet Standard 100 by Oeko-Tex® confirming they have been tested for harmful substances and certified by Woolmark with regards colour fastness meeting standards  TM250, TM165 and TM5. Jacquard knit, 12 gauge Straight finish to outer edges Signature RÆBURN shark design RÆBURN RÆCYCLED merino label to front hem RÆBURN branded label to reverse Fabric Details100% Merino Wool

description: The RÆBURN Men's Puffin Polkadot Tee has been manufactured in Portugal and features a signature print developed by RÆBURN inspired by puffins in flight. The RÆBURN Men's Parasuit Jacket has been RÆMADE using original parachute canopies which have been over-dyed in the UK to achieve a textured and lightweight crinkle and then meticulously deconstructed and reconstructed at the RÆBURN Lab in East London to deliver this series of reimagined Tailoring. A signature material for the brand since it's first collection in 2009 which featured a range of outerwear constructed from one military parachute, the brands logo which consists of four coloured segments (Sand, Camo Green, Orange and White) also is inspired by and mirror the C9 Parachute Canopy. The RÆBURN Men's Air Brake Tee has been RÆMADE using original Air Brake Parachutes (also known as Drogue parachutes) which have been over-dyed in the UK. Air Brake Parachutes are designed for deployment from a rapidly-moving objects to decrease speed, provide control and stability, or as a pilot parachute to deploy larger parachutes and used by aircraft, and spacecraft recovery systems. These items have been meticulously deconstructed and reconstructed at the RÆBURN Lab in East London. The RÆBURN Women's Anti-G Pkt Shirt has been manufactured in Bulgaria and produced in a 125gsm Global Organic Textile Standard Approved 100% organic cotton from Italy which meets the OCS 100 - Organic Content Standard, verifying the presence and amount of organic content in the final raw material. The RÆBURN Women's Anti-G Vest has been RÆMADE using original g-suits or the more accurately named anti-g suit combined with bivouac sacks. Anti-g suits are flight suits worn by aviators and astronauts who are subject to high levels of acceleration force (g). It is designed to prevent a black-out and g-LOC (g-induced loss of consciousness) caused by the blood pooling in the lower part of the body when under acceleration, thus depriving the brain of blood. Bivouac sacks (bivy) is a waterproof cover for a sleeping bag that may be used in place of a tent by minimalist, experienced hikers. A bivy bag may also be carried by day hikers as a backup or emergency shelter, to be used if they cannot make it back to their starting point by nightfall due to inclement weather or getting lost. These items have been meticulously deconstructed and reconstructed at the RÆBURN Lab in East London to deliver this series of reimagined Limited Edition Vests. The RÆBURN Men's Anti-G Shorts have been RÆMADE using original g-suits or the more accurately named anti-g suit combined with bivouac sacks. Anti-g suits are flight suits worn by aviators and astronauts who are subject to high levels of acceleration force (g). It is designed to prevent a black-out and g-LOC (g-induced loss of consciousness) caused by the blood pooling in the lower part of the body when under acceleration, thus depriving the brain of blood. Bivouac sacks (bivy) is a waterproof cover for a sleeping bag that may be used in place of a tent by minimalist, experienced hikers. A bivy bag may also be carried by day hikers as a backup or emergency shelter, to be used if they cannot make it back to their starting point by nightfall due to inclement weather or getting lost. These items have been meticulously deconstructed and reconstructed at the RÆBURN Lab in East London to deliver this series of reimagined Limited Edition Bomber Legwear. description: The RÆBURN Women's Silk Map Hooded Sweat has been crafted at the RÆBURN Lab in East London, each piece entirely unique depending on which part of the individual map we use. The 1950's Silk Maps are an increasingly rare artefact that have become an iconic part of the brand, forming an evolving range of luxurious womenswear and accessory pieces. Originally given to Royal Air Force crewmen in WW2 and beyond into the Cold War period of the 1950's, they helped individuals find a route out of enemy territory.⁠ The base of the hoodie is a mid-weight deadstock jersey from our atelier which has been embellished with these silk map stripe details, made from the off-cut's from our RÆMADE production line. The RÆBURN Men's Air Brake Anorak has been RÆMADE using original Air Brake Parachutes (also known as Drogue parachutes) which have been over-dyed in the UK. Air Brake Parachutes are designed for deployment from a rapidly-moving objects to decrease speed, provide control and stability, or as a pilot parachute to deploy larger parachutes and used by aircraft, and spacecraft recovery systems. These items have been meticulously deconstructed and reconstructed at the RÆBURN Lab in East London to deliver this series of reimagined outerwear. The RÆBURN Men's Standard Issue Crew Neck Sweatshirt with embroidered parachute logo stands for a continuous and evolving range of quality, responsible, unisex staples that will never go on sale. Set of 4 - packaged with a recycled fabric tie. Makes a perfect gift. Paper: Made in Sri Lanka from elephant dung. Why? Elephant dung is a free resource that once cleaned and processed, makes a great textured paper. Elephants are being killed in Sri Lanka, but thanks to Project Maximus (Ellie Pooh Paper) using elephant dung has helped to raise farmers’ tolerance towards elephants as they are now seen as an economic asset. Printing: Each card is hand block printed by a young adult in a training program for those with autism and severe handicap disabilities in India. The proceeds from these cards support their education and on-going training. Dyes: All dyes are an eco-friendly Azo-free pigment dye.

display_name: Organic Cotton Cropped Shoulder T-Shirt With C-Fiber™—Khaki
size: ['Khaki XXS', 'Khaki XS', 'Khaki S', 'Khaki M', 'Khaki L', 'Khaki XL', 'Khaki XXL']
description: This Khaki Cropped Shoulder T-shirt is made with saltwater Seaweed Fiber, Organic Cotton and treated with our trademark technology: PPRMINT™ oil. PPRMINT™ has natural antibacterial and antimicrobial properties to keep your T-shirt fresh for longer, meaning it can be washed less often—saving water, energy and time. The fit is regular, with cropped sleeves. This shade of Khaki was created using Environmentally Friendly Dyes and a recycled water system.  King is 189cm / 6’2  and wears a size M in Black.  ###

display_name: Organic Cotton Classic Tank With C-Fiber™—Grey
size: ['Grey XXS', 'Grey XS', 'Grey S', 'Grey M', 'Grey L', 'Grey XL']
description: The material of the Seaweed Fiber Tank Tops is ribbed, with a soft-hand feel. Seaweed grows freely and abundantly in a natural ocean habitat. We source ours from the sparsely populated Icelandic Fjords, in locations where there is zero waste in the water, and zero pollution from ship traffic. The process removes only the part that is able to regenerate and is harvested every 4 years, allowing for full replenishment in between. The fiber is carbon neutral and 100% biodegradable.  ###

display_name: Kids Wahp Polar Bear Cub Track Pants—Persimmon Orange
size: ['Persimmon Orange 3 YR', 'Persimmon Orange 6 YR', 'Persimmon Orange 9 YR', 'Persimmon Orange 12 YR']
description: PANGAIA x We Are Hairy People (WAHP) is an initiative to raise awareness around endangered animals and highlight the importance of mindful consumption. This upcycling capsule features unique, hand-painted designs that give old styles a new life. These Track Pants are created using a soft loopback fabric similar to French Terry, made from organic cotton and features a hand-painted Polar Bear Cub. By protecting the places where they live, we can help them thrive and contribute to their ecosystem, maintaining a balanced and healthy planet. Did you know? Polar bears are very strong, with paws the size of dinner plates, and despite looking white they actually have black skin underneath transparent fur. Climate change has caused their Arctic ice cap habitats to melt, leaving the population of polar bears vulnerable (around 26,000 left). ### Kenedy is 121cm / 3'11, she is wearing a size 6YR.

Meet FLWRDWN™️: A bio-based down-fill material created using natural wild flowers and a biopolymer. Both materials are biodegradable and infused with aerogel for performance and durability. This Hibiscus Red Puffer Scarf is 2m in length with a slot to secure it around the neck. The style is quilted, with our classic text block and an embroidered FLWRDWN™ logo. This plant-powered, breathable alternative to traditional animal-derived down is designed to keep you warm and cozy, even in the coldest climates.  ###

size: ['Pale Grey Melange XS', 'Pale Grey Melange S', 'Pale Grey Melange M', 'Pale Grey Melange L', 'Pale Grey Melange XL', 'Pale Grey Melange XXL']
description: Introducing our Recycled Cashmere Track Pants made from a post-consumer Recycled Cashmere Blend (GRS certified) sourced from garments collected in the US and EU. Responsibly soft, cozy and warm. These Pale Grey Melange Track Pants have a ribbed, elasticated waistband with a drawstring and two side pockets. The fit is relaxed with ribbed cuffs at the hem. We choose post-consumer materials like discarded garments (existing fabrics), rather than pre-consumer materials like production offcuts (unused fabrics), meaning we’re able to give the fibers a second life. This helps reduce reliance on virgin resources, diverts waste from landfill and supports the transition to a circular economy. Please note: Due to import restrictions we are unable to ship our recycled cashmere products to Saudi Arabia at this time. ### Mahlon is 178cm / 5’10 , he is wearing a size M.

display_name: Kids Wahp Polar Bear Sweatshirt—Persimmon Orange
size: ['Persimmon Orange 3 YR', 'Persimmon Orange 6 YR', 'Persimmon Orange 9 YR', 'Persimmon Orange 12 YR']
description: PANGAIA x We Are Hairy People (WAHP) is an initiative to raise awareness around endangered animals and highlight the importance of mindful consumption. This upcycling capsule features unique, hand-painted designs that give old styles a new life. The Sweatshirt is created using a soft loopback fabric similar to French Terry, made from organic cotton and features a hand-painted Polar Bear. By protecting the places where they live, we can help them thrive and contribute to their ecosystem, maintaining a balanced and healthy planet. Did you know? Polar bears are very strong, with paws the size of dinner plates, and despite looking white they actually have black skin underneath transparent fur. Climate change has caused their Arctic  ice cap habitats to melt, leaving the population of polar bears vulnerable (around 26,000 left). ### Kenedy is 121cm / 3'11, she is wearing a size 6YR.

display_name: Flwrdwn™ Fitted Long Puffer Jacket—Orchid Purple
size: ['Orchid Purple XS', 'Orchid Purple S', 'Orchid Purple M', 'Orchid Purple L', 'Orchid Purple XL']
description: Meet FLWRDWN™️: A bio-based down-fill material created using natural wild flowers and a biopolymer. Both materials are biodegradable and infused with aerogel for performance and durability. This Orchid Purple Long Fitted Puffer Jacket has an adjustable drawcord hood and hits between the knee and mid-calf, depending on your height. It has two external side pockets and one internal patch pocket, all with snap fastenings. It also has a two-way zipper with concealed snaps, finished with a concealed ribbed sleeve cuff. This plant-powered, breathable alternative to traditional animal-derived down is designed to keep you warm and cozy, even in the coldest climates.  ###

size: ['Navy Blue US0', 'Navy Blue US2', 'Navy Blue US4', 'Navy Blue US6', 'Navy Blue US8', 'Navy Blue US10']
description: Introducing our Recycled Cashmere Hoodie made from a post-consumer Recycled Cashmere Blend (GRS certified) sourced from garments collected in the US and EU. Responsibly soft, cozy and warm. This Navy Blue Hoodie is a casual, loose fit with a raglan sleeve and our classic PANGAIA shaped hood. It has a kangaroo pocket at the front, a deep rib at the hem and sleeve cuffs. We choose post-consumer materials like discarded garments (existing fabrics), rather than pre-consumer materials like production offcuts (unused fabrics), meaning we’re able to give the fibers a second life. This helps reduce reliance on virgin resources, diverts waste from landfill and supports the transition to a circular economy. Please note: Due to import restrictions we are unable to ship our recycled cashmere products to Saudi Arabia at this time.  Our styles are still available in the sizes you know and love, we’ve simply adjusted them to US 0-US 10 so it’s a bit easier to choose which size is right for you. Please note, your product may still have our previous size convention on the label (eg. if you have ordered a US 8, you may receive your garment with a size L label but don’t worry, the measurements haven’t changed). ### Raihanna is 173cm / 5’8, she is wearing a size US 4.

Our Kids Lightweight is designed to be as versatile as their lifestyle. Play in them, lounge in them and more. The Lightweight Hoodie is made from 100% organic cotton, treated with our trademark technology PPRMINT™ oil. PPRMINT™ has natural antibacterial and antimicrobial properties to keep your clothing fresher for longer, meaning it can be washed less often—saving water, energy and time. The material is a thinner, lightweight t-shirt fabric and the style is designed to be comfy and loose with no elastic. The Sand color was created using Environmentally Friendly Dyes and a recycled water system. ### Solomon is 111cm / 3’7, he is wearing a size 5-6YR.

description: The colors of the Ocean Collection are inspired by the natural hues of the world’s 3 largest bodies of water: The Pacific, Atlantic and Indian Oceans. The Pacific Ocean is the largest in the world.  We used Environmentally Friendly Dyes and a recycled water system to create these vibrant colors. The method uses a dyeing process with low water consumption and treatment of textile effluents, aiming to reuse water during the washing processes. We created these breathable summer Track Pants using a lightweight fabric similar to 'terry cotton', made from 100% Organic Cotton.  ### Hody is 174cm / 5’8, she is wearing a size S. display_name: Organic Cotton Long Sleeve Cropped T-Shirt—Cobalt Blue
size: ['Cobalt Blue XS', 'Cobalt Blue S', 'Cobalt Blue M', 'Cobalt Blue L', 'Cobalt Blue XL', 'Cobalt Blue XXL', 'Cobalt Blue XXS']
description: Mother Earth and its beautiful blue color (as seen from space) is the inspiration behind the Cobalt blue hue. Cobalt blue was first recorded as a color name in English back in 1777. Now, in 2019, it is one of the seven colors of PANGAIA (Pan meaning ‘all-inclusive’, especially in relation to the whole of a continent, racial group or religion and Gaia meaning ‘Mother Earth’).  ###

display_name: Organic Cotton Long Sleeve Cropped T-Shirt—Persimmon Orange
size: ['Persimmon Orange XS', 'Persimmon Orange S', 'Persimmon Orange M', 'Persimmon Orange L', 'Persimmon Orange XL', 'Persimmon Orange XXL', 'Persimmon Orange XXS']
description: The PANGAIA brand color orange was inspired by clownfish that form a symbiotic relationship with anemones. The toxic anemone provides protection from predators and leftovers for the clownfish. In return, the clownfish drives off intruders and preens the anemone (by removing parasites). All clownfish are born male with the ability to switch their sex (which is irreversible). Sometimes the change is made when mating. Two males will become mates and the larger, dominant fish will become the female. If the female dies, the dominant male will become a female to replace her.  ###

description: The Half-Zip Sweatshirt is made from soft organic cotton, treated with natural PPRMINT™ Oil to keep it fresher for longer – saving water, energy and time spent washing. It’s a medium weight fabric, with a loop back texture inside and a finishing that provides extra softness. It has a high rib neck, half-zip detail with a recycled zip and dropped shoulders. Its relaxed boxy shape is more cropped than the men’s. The Saffron Yellow color was created using Environmentally Friendly Dyes and a recycled water system. Our styles are still available in the sizes you know and love, we’ve simply adjusted them to US 0-US 10 so it’s a bit easier to choose which size is right for you. Please note, your product may still have our previous size convention on the label (eg. if you have ordered a US 8, you may receive your garment with a size L label but don’t worry, the measurements haven’t changed). ### Amrita is 175cm / 5’9 , she is wearing a size US4.

The Sand color was created using Environmentally Friendly Dyes and a recycled water system. display_name: Kids Northern Lights Long Shorts—Northern Green
description: Nature is our biggest inspiration and where better to look than the greatest light show on Earth? The Northern Lights capsule is an ode to one of the 7 natural wonders of the world and its awe-inspiring beauty. The Kids Long Shorts are made from 100% organic cotton. They’re a medium weight fabric, with a loop back texture inside and a finishing that provides extra softness. The Northern Green color was inspired by the natural phenomena caused by charged cosmic particles entering Earth’s atmosphere.### Alora is 111cm / 3’7, she is wearing a size 5-6YR.

3 hours each way, approx. 1 tonne of CO2 With the help of our partner SeaTrees, we’re offering you the chance to offset your short-haul return flight. Climate change presents an urgent challenge and 100% of profits will fund SeaTrees' mission to protect and restore coastal ecosystems through conservation projects. These include protecting a REDD+, VCS and CCBA certified, ""ridge to reef"" watershed project in the Southern Cardamom Mountains, Cambodia, planting mangrove trees in Indonesia and restoring kelp forests in California. These projects create jobs for local communities and protect biodiversity and threatened species such as dugongs (sea cows) and Irrawaddy dolphins. Please consider this as part of your efforts to reduce your carbon footprint—rather than as a substitute. Please note these credits are non-refundable. Flight carbon emissions assume a round trip flight and include radiative forcing effects. (DEFRA 2018) Driving carbon emissions assumes UK average of 40.6 mpg (5.8 liters / 100km) - (IEA 2019)

display_name: Protect Jaguars With José In Colombia
description: Donate to impacter José José González-Maya and ProCAT Your support goes directly to ProCAT in Colombia. Impacter José González-Maya is an Anthropologist and Scientific Director fighting to save the jaguars, Andean bears and harlequin frogs in the Amazon and the entire ecosystems they influence. José and ProCAT collect data on the abundance of wildlife in the area through camera traps, satellite collars and citizen science projects to gain insight on the challenges the species are facing. Through projects like the Jaguar Friendly initiative, he works with local communities to incentivize the protection of flagship species. They offer compensation through agricultural assistance, access to international markets and eco-labelling in return for assurances of working against poaching and for conservation. Protecting biodiversity around the globe is one of the greatest challenges our generation face. Through this new initiative in partnership with Milkywire, we aim to support grassroots NGOs working to preserve and protect endangered and vulnerable species worldwide.   Please note these credits are non-refundable.

display_name: Support Bee Research With Mats In Sweden
description: Donate to impacter Mats Niklasson and Nordens Ark Your support goes directly to the Tag a Bee project in Sweden. The aim of this project is to tag 5,000 bees with RFID chips (radio-frequency identification) to learn how, when and where they fly to collect pollen. This knowledge will help protect and inform the preservation of both domestic and wild bees. Bees play an integral role in the functioning of our ecosystems and are disappearing at an alarming rate. We launched the Bee The Change Fund in May 2020, powered by Milkywire. This fund supports grassroots NGOs working to preserve and protect species worldwide from extinction. Please note these credits are non-refundable.

display_name: Build B-Lines For Bees With Paul In The Uk
description: Donate to impacter Paul Hetherington and Buglife Your support goes directly to the B-Lines project in the UK, a network of ‘insect pathways’ running across the British landscape. Pollinators, including bees, are confined to tiny fragments of habitat and unable to move across the countryside as our climate and landscape change. It has been predicted that 40-70% of species could go extinct if action is not taken. That’s where B-Lines come in. Bees play an integral role in the functioning of our ecosystems and are disappearing at an alarming rate. We launched the Bee The Change Fund in May 2020, powered by Milkywire. This fund supports grassroots NGOs working to preserve and protect species worldwide from extinction.    Please note these credits are non-refundable.

display_name: Support Marine Life Research With Michael In Kenya
description: Donate to impacter Michael Mwang'ombe and the Kenya Marine Mammal Research and Conservation Your support goes directly to the Kenya Marine Mammal Network, a dolphin and whale conservation coalition working to collect data on dolphins and humpback whales breeding in the Indian Ocean. Impacter Michael Mwang'ombe documents large marine mammals through photography and tracking, and analyses data to gain knowledge on the relatively undocumented and unknown marine mammals of Kenya. He works with fishermen, local populations and the government to spread awareness of the effects of climate change and other human-induced threats. He also creates educational material and lectures at schools.  Protecting biodiversity around the globe is one of the greatest challenges our generation face. Through this new initiative in partnership with Milkywire, we aim to support grassroots NGOs working to preserve and protect endangered and vulnerable species worldwide.   Please note these credits are non-refundable.

display_name: Protect Sea Turtles With Christine In Costa Rica
description: Donate to impacter Christine Figgener and Nāmaka Conservation Science Your support goes directly to Nāmaka Conservation Science in Costa Rica. Impacter Christine Figgener is a Marine Conservation Biologist who helped set the global anti-plastic movement in motion, while fighting for the survival and protection of sea turtles.  Christine works on the ground to protect nesting sea turtles and their eggs from people who steal and sell them and studies the migratory behavior of sea turtles out at sea to better understand their biology. Protecting biodiversity around the globe is one of the greatest challenges our generation face. Through this new initiative in partnership with Milkywire, we aim to support grassroots NGOs working to preserve and protect endangered and vulnerable species worldwide. Please note these credits are non-refundable.

display_name: Help Francois Rescue Trafficked Pangolins In South Africa
description: Donate to impacter Francois Meyer and the African Pangolin Working Group Your support goes directly to the African Pangolin Working Group in South Africa. Impacter Francois Meyer is a Conservation Ecologist fighting to save the world’s most trafficked mammal, the pangolin, from illegal wildlife trafficking. Francois works closely with the police to seize traded wild pangolins, assisting law enforcement with sting operations and gathering evidence for court case hearings of traffickers. A severely injured pangolin goes through a hospitalization and rehabilitation process to see if it is stable enough to survive in the wild again. After the pangolin is released, it’s tracked and monitored by Francois and his team.  Protecting biodiversity around the globe is one of the greatest challenges our generation face. Through this new initiative in partnership with Milkywire, we aim to support grassroots NGOs working to preserve and protect endangered and vulnerable species worldwide.   Please note these credits are non-refundable.

display_name: Help Dino Conserve Bees In East Africa
description: Donate to impacter Dino Martins and the Mpala Research Centre Your support goes directly to the Mpala Research Centre in Kenya. The use of agricultural pesticides and loss of natural habitats has seen bee numbers decline dramatically. At Mpala Research Centre, Dino Martins works with farmers in East Africa to raise awareness about the importance of pollinators and encourage more sustainable farming practices that conserve bees, boost crops and improve livelihoods. Bees play an integral role in the functioning of our ecosystems and are disappearing at an alarming rate. We launched the Bee The Change Fund in May 2020, powered by Milkywire. This fund supports grassroots NGOs working to preserve and protect species worldwide from extinction.   Please note these credits are non-refundable.
